info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:55PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Broadwater, south central Meagher, eastern Madison, southeastern Beaverhead, southeastern Jefferson and Gallatin Counties through 830 PM MDT... At 754 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pony to near Ennis to 24 miles northwest of Henrys Lake to 10 miles northwest of Kilgore. Movement was northeast at 90 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bozeman, West Yellowstone, Belgrade, Three Forks, Manhattan, Ennis, Pony, Harrison, Big Sky, Targhee Pass, Cameron, Missouri Headwaters State Park, Maudlow, Red Rock Pass, Amsterdam, Four Corners, Jeffers, Trident, Madison Buffalo Jump State Park, and Norris. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to minor localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southwestern Montana.
